turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new games to play. I'm really into strategy games, any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Sure! For strategy games, have you tried 'Crusader Kings III' or 'Civilization VI'? Both are very popular and well-received.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I've played both of those to death. Something a little less... mainstream? Maybe something indie?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay! How about 'Into the Breach'? It's a turn-based strategy game with roguelike elements. Very challenging and rewarding.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, that sounds interesting. What about something that's real-time strategy? I miss those.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: For real-time strategy, I'd suggest 'StarCraft II' or 'Company of Heroes 2'. They are both considered classics in the genre.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I've heard good things about Company of Heroes 2. So, a bit of a challenging question - if you had to pick the *one* strategy game that best represents the genre and its evolution over the last 20 years, what would it be and why?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a tough one! If I had to choose, I'd say 'StarCraft II'. It refined the RTS formula, set a high bar for esports, and continues to be relevant due to its strategic depth and active community, showing both the genre's past and present potential. Though, 'Civilization' also deserves a mention.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Alright, fair enough. Thanks for the suggestions, I'll check out Company of Heroes 2 and maybe give StarCraft II another look.
